projects.title: Dirt.Farm
projects.description: The most advanced application I have made so far. Myself and 3 classmates built a relaxing web-based farming game in 4 days. I was responsible for a great deal of the game logic, which was programmed in JavaScript. My favorite features to implement were the click detection event handler and the plant growth timing event. The former worked by decoding attributes encoded into the HTML elements to respond appropriately to the user, and the latter manipulated living plant objects to change their appearance and maturity over time.

projects.title: Bus Mall
projects.description: This is a customer interest survey app for Bus Mall, the most prestigious fictional product catalogue, found in public transportation near you. Using Chart.js and the technologies below, I built an app which tracks the selections a user makes in a set number of voting rounds. A nifty Chart.js bar chart displays your lifetime voting behavior, which persists between browser sessions

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: My second project made at Code Fellows. This website advertised a fictional cookie store, selling delicious and fishy Salmon Cookies in 5 global locations. My favorite part of this project is the dynamic data table found on the Sales page. Every value is dynamic, and it was the barely the second time I had ever made code-generated HTML.
